data.title: The Magazine About Ferrari
data.meta_description: Forza magazine reports on Ferrari automobiles, history, racing, personalities and news. Your best resource on Ferraris, published 8 times a year.
data.text:
The 200-mph Club

We drive the first two street-legal supercars to breach the double ton.

Record Breaker

The SF90 XX Stradale pushes the limits of road-car performance—and blurs the line between street and circuit.

Hybrid Done Right

The 296 GTB offers a new vision of hybridization—and it’s truly astonishing.

Rolling Fantasy

What do you get when you combine a LaFerrari Aperta, an 812 Competizione, and a 330 P4? The stunning Daytona SP3.

Two Steps Forward

The 348 pushed Ferrari’s V8 sports cars into new performance territory, but early examples suffered from serious quality issues.

Power Trip

The F12 offers great looks and even better handling, but Ferrari’s mighty 6.3-liter V12 is unquestionably the star of the show.

Brand Expansion

Ferrari developed the all-new California to lure GT buyers away from other marques.

Impact

The 308 introduced Ferrari to a new worldwide audience and launched an era of V8-powered sports cars.

Fashion Sense

In the 1950s, Carrozzeria Vignale and the prolific Giovanni Michelotti provided the same coachwork for two very different automobiles.

Spur of the Moment

For most of us, a 14-month road trip in a 40-year-old Ferrari would entail plenty of planning. Brian Whalen just jumped in his 308 and started driv...

Eastern Promises

In the early 1990s, Honda introduced an all-new supercar that promised to beat the European establishment—including Ferrari.

Real Deal?

While the Mondial has courted controversy since its debut, the owners of this early example says the dislike isn’t deserved.

Homegrown Boxer

This 365 GT4 BB sat undriven for decades in Ron Caldwell’s garage. In 2018, he restored it there, too.

Right the First Time

A brand-new restoration shop turned this race-prepped SWB into a concours winner—in less than three months.

Crunch Time

The two-year rebirth of this totaled F355 was completed two weeks before the Ferrari was due at the 2015 FCA International Meet.

Two-Pedal Blues

Although Mike Pucciarelli liked his 575M, he wasn’t a fan of its F1 transmission—so he had the car converted to a stick-shift.

Undercover

Matt Peak’s 308 looks stock. It’s not, and a 485-hp 3.9-liter V8 is only part of the story.

Tribute TR

Peter Giacobbi couldn’t afford an authentic 1950s sports racer, so he made his own.

Long and Winding Road

It took nearly 18 years to create this modern-day tribute to the NART Spyder.

The Veteran

At age 49, former Formula 1 driver and Le Mans winner Giancarlo Fisichella shows no signs of slowing down.

No-Sale Blues

This 360 Spider sat unwanted and unloved at a dealership until Richard Maury spotted it.

The Multi-Talented Mr. Hobbs

During a 30-year career, David Hobbs drove everything from sports cars and NASCARs to prototypes to IndyCars and F1 cars—with more than a few Ferr...

Unbridled Passion

Since Phil and Martha Bachman bought their first Ferrari in the early 1980s, they’ve travelled the world with their FXX, become longtime concours j...

In the Camp of the Enemy

Events at home in Argentina led Juan Manuel Fangio to drive for Ferrari—the team he’d been competing against for eight years.

The Milanese Connection

Few episodes in Ferrari’s history are as unusual as its creation of a small four-cylinder car that was put into production by a wealthy Milan enthu...

The Rise and Fall of Scuderia Ferrari

From its founding in 1929 until its liquidation in 1937, Enzo Ferrari’s Alfa Romeo racing stable scored an astonishing 144 wins in 225 races.

The Wilderness Years

After being fired by Alfa Romeo then having his new company nationalized for the war effort, Enzo Ferrari turned to manufacturing mechanical compon...

True Grit

This 208 GT4 took on the grueling, 8,700-mile Peking to Paris Motor Challenge.
